title: Vast Expansion in Aid Kept Food Insecurity From Growing Last Year
description: As 20 million jobs vanished at the start of the coronavirus pandemic and traffic jams formed outside food banks, many experts warned that the twin crises of unemployment and disease would produce soaring rates of hunger.

title: Venice Film Festival: Tim Blake Nelson Gets the Lead. Someone Send Him a Tux.
description: VENICE  The first time Tim Blake Nelson went to the Venice Film Festival was three years ago, as one of the featured players in the western anthology The Ballad of Buster Scruggs, directed by Joel and Ethan Coen. As Nelson soon learned, trailing those filmmakers around Venice can open an endless number of doors.

title: Tell Us What You Love About the Outdoors for Our Black History Series
description: How do you find purpose, joy and peace in the great outdoors?

title: Supreme Court Will Return to Its Courtroom Next Month
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court will resume hearing arguments in person when its new term starts in October, after a break of more than a year in response to the coronavirus pandemic, the court announced on Wednesday.

title: New York Fashion Week: Day 1
description: Fashion Week is back in full force, and theres a lot to see. Blink (or scroll too fast on Instagram) and youll miss the details: tiny bags, tall shoes, feathered hats, leather capes and diamond dog collars. Every day well spotlight one thing we saw on the runways that delighted or mystified us.

title: First Host of Blues Clues Returns, Striking a Chord With Grown-Ups
description: One day in 2002, Steve Burns packed up a bulging backpack and suitcase, said farewell to a speckled blue dog and a room of cartoon furniture, and disappeared into a two-dimensional school bus.

title: Professors Fight Mask Bans
description: Today, some professors fear that the new school year could go off the rails.

title: Mr. Chavarria Will See You Now
description: Late one evening 55 years ago, in the winter of 1966, an Irish-American teenager named Gwen Taylor climbed through the window of her familys house in Coalinga, a small town in Californias San Joaquin Valley, and, flipping up the kickstand on a bicycle parked outside, pedaled by moonlight through the vineyards of this farming region, and across Interstate 5 to a town called Huron.

title: The Supreme Court will resume hearing arguments in person in October.
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court will resume hearing arguments in person when its new term starts in October, after a break of almost 18 months in response to the coronavirus pandemic, the court announced on Wednesday.

title: Those Weve Lost Since 9/11
description: With the 20th anniversary of Sept. 11 approaching, were remembering a handful of people who were shaped by the day of the attacks who have died since.

title: Macys plans a vaccinated Thanksgiving Day parade that will resume many traditions.
description: Participants in the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade must be masked and vaccinated, with a few exceptions, the company said on Wednesday, as the annual tradition plans a return to a version of its old self this November after a muted performance last year.

title: On the Scene: A Rosh Hashana Ritual
description: Dozens of Jews flocked to the Hudson River on Tuesday where they tossed bread into the water to symbolize throwing away their sins.

title: The U.S. Is Not Ready for Climate Reality
description: The climate disasters have been relentless this summer. Hurricane Ida took down the power grid in New Orleans, where more than 300,000 households remain without electricity as of Wednesday. A few days later, Ida dumped 7 inches of rain on New York City, drowning people in their basements and paralyzing the subways. Deadly heat waves scorched the Pacific Northwest, a massive wildfire spurred residents to evacuate South Lake Tahoe and flash floods devastated Tennessee.

title: The Disaster Beat
description: Covering Katrina weakened my faith in the countrys preparedness. The coronavirus has robbed me of it completely.

title: A Biblical Mystery at Oxford
description: A renowned scholar claimed that he discovered a first-century gospel fragment. Now hes facing allegations of antiquities theft, cover-up, and fraud.

title: Why Is Witchcraft on the Rise?
description: Americans interest in spell-casting tends to wax as instability rises and trust in establishment ideas plummets.

title: Phil Schaap, Grammy-Winning Jazz D.J. and Historian, Dies at 70
description: Phil Schaap, who explored the intricacy and history of jazz in radio programs that he hosted, Grammy-winning liner notes that he wrote, music series that he programmed and classes that he taught, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 70.

title: Sex Cult Leaders Top Deputy Sentenced to 42 Months in Prison
description: For 20 years, Nancy Salzman and Keith Raniere were business partners and allies who promised to improve peoples lives.

title: Inside Tech's Fever Dream
description: Drawn into the tech world, a 20-something wonders why she  and the rest of us  didnt wise up to the grandiose myopia sooner.

title: Anarchy, and $$$, in the Vintage Punk Clothing Market
description: Not long ago, Paul Gorman, a pop culture historian in London, the author of The Life & Times of Malcolm McLaren: The Biography and an authenticator for auction houses that specialize in rock fashion, was given a shirt attributed to Malcolm McLaren and Vivienne Westwoods Seditionaries label, circa 1977, to assess.

title: Covax, a global program to distribute Covid vaccines, cuts its 2021 forecast for available doses by a quarter.
description: The United Nations-backed program to vaccinate the world against the coronavirus slashed its forecast for doses available in 2021 by roughly a quarter on Wednesday, another setback for an effort that has been hampered by production problems, export bans and vaccine hoarding by wealthy nations.

title: Armed Thieves Steal Jewels From Bulgari Store in Paris
description: The three men, dressed in suits, could have passed for customers at the Bulgari store in central Paris. Armed with guns, however, their intentions were more nefarious. They stole a large haul of jewels from the Italian jewelry company.

title: Bitcoin Is an Official Currency in This Country
description: El Salvador recently became the first country to adopt Bitcoin.

title: A Pandemic, Then a Hurricane, Brings New Orleans Musicians to Their Knees
description: When Hurricane Ida swept through New Orleans late last month, it took a piece of history with it. The Karnofsky Tailor Shop and Residence, a decrepit red brick building that had served as a kind of second home for Louis Armstrong during his boyhood in the early 1900s, was reduced to rubble.

title: W.H.O. Calls for a Moratorium on Boosters Through End of the Year
description: The World Health Organization asked wealthy nations to hold off on distributing coronavirus booster shots to healthy people until at least the end of the year in an effort to reserve vaccine supplies for low-income nations struggling to access first-doses for their populations.

title: GoFundMe Nation
description: The largest crowdfunding site in the world puts up a mirror to who we are and what matters most to us. Try not to look away.

title: Caroline Calloway Isnt a Scammer
description: Her Instagram account reads like Brideshead Revisited meets Twilight meets Vanity Fair magazine circa 1988.

title: County I.T. Supervisor Mined Bitcoin at the Office, Prosecutors Say
description: A Long Island man was charged on Wednesday with using his position as an I.T. supervisor for Suffolk County to mine cryptocurrency from government offices, costing the county thousands of dollars in electricity.

title: As Taliban Crush Dissent, New Leaders Face Cascading Challenges
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Only one day after the Taliban named an acting cabinet to lead the nation they spent two decades trying to conquer, the dizzying challenges that accompanied victory were coming into sharp relief Wednesday.

title: Covid Zero Is No Longer Working for Australia
description: Australia was, until recently, heralded for its effective suppression of Covid-19; through strict border closures, prolonged lockdowns and its fortune as a remote island continent, the country was able to avoid a large-scale outbreak. The Delta variant has, however, turned that success upside down.

title: Edna O'Brien's Lonely Girls
description: The setting of her new novel is terror-ridden Nigeria, a world away from her native Ireland, but the psychic territory is familiar.

title: This Land Was Our Land
description: The shameful story of how 1 million black families have been ripped from their farms

title: Joe Bidens Grief, and That of Others
description: To the Editor:

title: Sometimes I Hate My Husbands Peloton
description: At the peak of the pandemic, my husband was embroiled in a full-blown love affair. It made him frequently unavailable, led to several surprising credit card statements and impinged upon family time. To quote Princess Diana, I started to feel that there were three of us in this marriage  and one of us was an exercise bike.

title: Why Don't Police Catch Serial Rapists?
description: What new research reveals about sexual predators, and why police fail to catch them.

title: Spaceship-Shaped Fossil Reveals Hungry Predator of Ancient Oceans
description: Some 506 million years ago, a predator swept over the silt bottoms of the Cambrian ocean. Its rake-like feeding arms sifted through the murk it raised, funneling soft-bodied worms into a puckering, circular mouth.

title: Californias Farms Face a Reckoning
description: The advantage of growing crops in an arid climate is that you rarely have to worry about too much rain. You can precisely control the moisture your crops get through irrigation. At the same time, the sunny days promote rapid plant growth. You can produce far more bounteous harvests in, say, Californias Imperial Valley, which gets about three inches of rain a year, than somewhere back east thats cloudy and sometimes too rainy.

title: The Wealth Gap Taints America's Success Stories
description: My family is a success story. Were also evidence of the long odds African Americans face on the path to success.

title: The Loser-Spy Novelist for Our Times
description: Mick Herron writes about the broken spies sworn to protect todays broken England.

description: A day after the Taliban named an acting cabinet to lead the nation they spent two decades trying to conquer, the dizzying challenges that accompanied victory were coming into sharp relief.

description: Welcome. I pruned the trailing jade plant yesterday, made a noodle kugel for Rosh Hashana and rode my bike into Manhattan for dinner.

title: Former N.F.L. Players Plead Guilty to Defrauding Insurance Plan
description: Clinton Portis, the former star running back in Washington and Denver, and two other former N.F.L. pros pleaded guilty for their roles in a wide-ranging effort to defraud a health care benefit program for retired players, the Justice Department announced Tuesday. Portis and Tamarick Vanover pleaded guilty on Friday, while Robert McCune, a ringleader of the scheme, entered his plea on Aug. 24.

title: Feds Williams hints that bond-buying taper could start even if job gains slow.
description: John C. Williams, the president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York and a powerful monetary policy official, hinted on Wednesday that it might be possible for the central bank to begin removing support for the economy before the end of the year even if the job market grows at a lackluster pace in coming months.

title: 5 Better Ways to Wake Up
description: We talked to sleep experts for tips on how to wake up on time and get more restful sleep.

description: Success in forensics is about making yourself vulnerable. Several former competitors accuse a prominent coach of exploiting that vulnerability to sexually harass students.

description: The Bohemian Rhapsody director Bryan Singer has been trailed by accusations of sexual misconduct for 20 years. Here, his alleged victims tell their stories.

description: The Komodo dragon has earned its status as a reptilian icon.

description: Monks, nomads, and a sports unlikely ascent in a remote corner of the globe.

title: Why Are We So Angry?
description: The untold story of how anger became the dominant emotion in our politics and personal livesand what we can do about it.

title: Joseph I. Kramer, the Country Doctor of Avenue D, Dies at 96
description: Joseph I. Kramer, who tended to the afflictions of the poor as the self-described country doctor of Manhattans Lower East Side for nearly three decades, a period, beginning in 1969, when the neighborhood was infamous for urban squalor, died on Aug. 30 at his home in Leonia, N.J. He was 96.

title: Michael Bloomberg: How New York City Can Bounce Back, Again
description: The future of New York City is being called into question. Neighborhoods have lost residents to the suburbs. Businesses have closed. People are on edge about public safety. And families are mourning the loss of loved ones.

title: Afghans Flee to Pakistan. An Uncertain Future Awaits.
description: TORKHAM, Pakistan  The Taliban, thankfully, didnt figure out Mohammad was a police officer.

title: Deputy Mayor of N.Y. Town Had 17 Illegal Guns in His Home
description: Brian Downey, the deputy mayor of a village located about an hours drive north of New York City, was arrested last week after an early morning court-ordered search of his residence turned up what the authorities said was an arsenal of weapons.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Several E.U. member nations  including Bulgaria, Italy, the Netherlands and Sweden  have imposed new restrictions after the bloc removed the United States from a list of safe countries.

title: How a Stroke Turned a 63-Year-Old Into a Rap Legend
description: The story of Dr. Rapp.

title: Lululemon says sales are soaring but supply chain issues remain a concern.
description: Even as Lululemon reported soaring sales on Wednesday and forecast a robust holiday season, the athleisure company sounded a note of caution because of pandemic-related factory shutdowns in Vietnam, echoing concerns about the global supply chain voiced by many apparel retailers in recent weeks.

title: High Crimes
description: Marijuana legalization was supposed to decrease crimebut the reality is more complicated.

title: Navy Helicopter Vibrated Before Falling Into the Sea, Report Says
description: A U.S. Navy helicopter that crashed off the coast near San Diego last week, killing five sailors, landed on an aircraft carrier and experienced vibrations before its main rotor struck the flight deck and the aircraft fell into the ocean, the Navy said in a safety report.

title: Tropical Depression Mindy Drenches Parts of Southeast on Its Way Out to Sea
description: The remnants of Tropical Storm Mindy brought heavy rain across parts of the Southeast on Thursday, less than a day after the storm formed in the Gulf of Mexico and made landfall along the Florida Panhandle.

title: Alberto Vilar, Arts Patron Convicted of Fraud, Dies at 80
description: Alberto W. Vilar, a money manager with a love of opera who used his wealth to become a conspicuous arts patron but fell out of favor when he reneged on his pledges and eventually went to prison for defrauding clients, died on Saturday at his home in Queens. He was 80.

title: Steady rain covers an already-saturated New York region.
description: Amid steady showers, up to 1.5 inches of rain was expected in the New York area on Thursday, a week after the region was battered by the remnants of Hurricane Ida.

title: How One Family Fled Afghanistan and Was Reunited in New York City
description: On Aug. 6, after spending the summer visiting his family in Afghanistan, Mohammad Wali kissed his wife and three children goodbye, headed to the Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul and boarded a plane back to New York City, where he lives and works.
